channel.title: The basics to using Toms Cache Suite
channel.description:
Well i know not everyone knows how to use Toms cache suite so I am going to show you how To use it :P
Firstly you need to have toms cache suite; can be downloaded I will post a link @ The end
Now lets get Started:
[size=15pt]Step 1: Basics[/size]
Open toms cache suite then click the jar file called "Suite" [img]http://i52.tinypic.com/2a945c4.jpg[/img]
Once in there It should look something like: [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/4uhz08.jpg[/img]
Now click:
File > Load Cache.
Then go to ur C:/ C drive and open the cache you want to edit.
Once done then it should look something like: [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/t8x5bc.jpg[/img]
I will now explain what they all do.
View/Edit Raw File System: This you don't really need to go into it's just all the main stuff the client reads.
View/Edit JaGeX Archives: Once again you won't really need this the client only reads this I'll explain it in a moment.
View/Edit Image Archives: This is where mainly all the cache packed stuff is for example. You magic Icons Both On And Off Your Background Login Box, Stat Icons Mapbacks mainly all the stuff you need and you can add your own stuff!
View/Edit Floor Configuration: This is all your floors ect You shouldn't have to go into this unless you want to change your floors.
View/Edit Item Configuration: This is basicly all your items that are loaded, Non customs.
[size=15pt]Step 2: Dumping[/size]
Ok now i will teach you how to Dump things.
In your cache open the:
View/Edite Image Archives;
A little drop box will pop up scroll down and Click 'Media';
Now once in there find sideIcons.dat Click on it.
You will then see an image in the little box and a fair bit of numbers In another box counted from 0-14 or w.e
They are all your sideIcons that are in your gameframe now to dump them what you do is.
In the Box area where the Image is find something that says.
"Export" [img]http://i55.tinypic.com/f1zd09.jpg[/img]
A box will then pop up and say
File Name And files of type.
[img]http://i54.tinypic.com/ivcwli.jpg[/img]
You keep Files of type the same and set the name to be whatever you want it to be called then change the path from and store it at your desktop or where ever you want it to go then you click save and it will go there :P And still be in your cache
[size=15pt]Step 3: Replacing Images[/size]
Now to replace it.
You click "Import"; [img]http://i56.tinypic.com/2yv8ke0.jpg[/img]
Now you find your Image This is pretty simple you should know how to find it. [img]http://i56.tinypic.com/2z8w500.jpg[/img]
Now if you done it correctly it will change [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/64p8a9.jpg[/img]
But remember to always before re-running your client click "Save Archive" In which will save your cache.
Hope this helped anyone that was un-sure as to how to use it. /:
Theres the link to download it.
http://uppit.com/v/GVBQ3AAR

item.title: The basics to using Toms Cache Suite
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“kthillman, post:16, topic:411156”]how should they be named, ect.?

would you mind hmu on teamviewer soon? :S[/quote]

Make sure you have these files:

main_file_cache.dat
main_file_cache.idx0
main_file_cache.idx1
main_file_cache.idx2
main_file_cache.idx3
main_file_cache.idx4

Read full topic
item.source: The basics to using Toms Cache Suite

item.title: The basics to using Toms Cache Suite
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“kthillman, post:14, topic:411156”]I KNOW THIS TOPIC IS OLD!!.. But I need help.

It will not load my cache.
I downloaded it to me desktop, and extracted it into another folder.

When I click on the folder ONCE and click “OPEN”… it says

An error has occured whilst loading cache java.io.IOException: unable to located cache data file Correct cache loaded? [/quote]

It’s good to see that somebody actually uses the search bar. Cookies for you.

Make sure that you’re loading the correct cache folder (the main_file_cache.dat stuff should be in that directory), check to make sure that the cache names are named correctly.

Oh and there is the whole thing about cache compatibility.

Read full topic
item.source: The basics to using Toms Cache Suite

item.title: The basics to using Toms Cache Suite
item.dc:creator: @C_Imbued C++ Imbued
item.description:
@C_Imbued wrote:

Well i know not everyone knows how to use Toms cache suite so I am going to show you how
To use it

Firstly you need to have toms cache suite; can be downloaded I will post a link @ The end

Now lets get Started:

[size=15pt]Step 1: Basics[/size]

Open toms cache suite then click the jar file called “Suite”

Once in there It should look something like:

Now click:

File > Load Cache.

Then go to ur C:/ C drive and open the cache you want to edit.

Once done then it should look something like:

t8x5bc.jpg745×422

I will now explain what they all do.

View/Edit Raw File System: This you don’t really need to go into it’s just all the main stuff the client reads.

View/Edit JaGeX Archives: Once again you won’t really need this the client only reads this I’ll explain it in a moment.

View/Edit Image Archives: This is where mainly all the cache packed stuff is for example. You magic Icons Both On And Off Your Background
Login Box, Stat Icons Mapbacks mainly all the stuff you need and you can add your own stuff!

View/Edit Floor Configuration: This is all your floors ect You shouldn’t have to go into this unless you want to change your floors.

View/Edit Item Configuration: This is basicly all your items that are loaded, Non customs.

[size=15pt]Step 2: Dumping[/size]

Ok now i will teach you how to Dump things.

In your cache open the:

View/Edite Image Archives;

A little drop box will pop up scroll down and Click ‘Media’;

Now once in there find sideIcons.dat Click on it.

You will then see an image in the little box and a fair bit of numbers
In another box counted from 0-14 or w.e

They are all your sideIcons that are in your gameframe now to dump them
what you do is.

In the Box area where the Image is find something that says.

“Export”

A box will then pop up and say

File Name And files of type.

You keep Files of type the same and set the name to be whatever you
want it to be called then change the path from and store it at your desktop
or where ever you want it to go then you click save and it will go there
And still be in your cache

[size=15pt]Step 3: Replacing Images[/size]

Now to replace it.

You click “Import”;

Now you find your Image This is pretty simple you should know how to find it.

Now if you done it correctly it will change

But remember to always before re-running your client click “Save Archive” In which
will save your cache.

Hope this helped anyone that was un-sure as to how to use it. /:

Theres the link to download it.

http://uppit.com/v/GVBQ3AAR
